intro: Genista apetala, commonly known as the pale broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant produces yellow flowers in early spring, which are clustered in racemes and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are small, needle-like, and arranged in pairs along the stems. Genista apetala is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates.
